title: Operational Data Engineer - Ab Initio & Snowflake
content:
Why PlayStation?
PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.
PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.
The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.Operational Data Engineer - Ab Initio & SnowflakeLondon
We have a great opportunity for an Operations Engineer to join our Data Strategy and Operations team in London. This role will undertake Operational duties as well as pick up support for our operations applications.
The Engineer is required to work within the Operations team with the successful applicant responsible for the operation and support of the Business Intelligence
Platform. They will be required to fit into a highly skilled team and work with limited supervision, under their own initiative.
The role is based in our London office, reporting to our Technical Engineering Manager. Currently the team is working in a flexible manner allowing for some remote working. This team provides business intelligence services for various global business units associated with Sony Interactive Entertainment.
What you'll be doing:
Provide 1st/2nd line support for the Production data processing platform, including response to and resolution of any failures, maintenance or upgrades
Proactive monitoring and troubleshooting of the platform
Undertake production releases into the platform
Ability to identify and automate manual tasks where you can make time or cost savings
Conduct code peer reviews with particular emphasis on operational aspects
Configuration management of code, covering versioning, deployments and building of tags
Investigation, management and prioritisation of any incidents or queries raised
Perform impact analysis, identifying ways to make operational improvements and make code changes to improve resilience or efficiency
Evaluate new capabilities built by vendors through PoC's or pilot projects
Liaise with data providers
Communication with end users and explanation of technical terms and concepts
Work with Scrum Masters, Developers and Product Owners to develop ideas and give updates on work
Acting as the first line advisory and support for end users on ‘How-to’ questions
Liaising with vendor with follow up on technical issues
What we're looking for:
2+ years experience in UNIX, including shell scripting, admin and utilities.
Skilled in scripting (Python, Bash)
Skilled in Linux and comfortable in using command line
Understand ETL concepts with 2-3 years proven experience with an ETL tool (Ab-Initio preferred)
Demonstrable experience working on and supporting large-scale complex data processing platforms
Experience in working with SQL and large data volumes
Understanding of other data processing technologies and knowledge of data warehouse appliances, e.g. Snowflake (preferred)
Undertaking Production environment releases
Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving ability
Interpersonal skills including presentation, negotiating, conflict resolution, etc
Strong communication skills
Proven abilities to work creatively and analytical in a problem-solving environment
Experience in a similar role, with proven expertise gained in complicated, business critical projects
Strong can-do attitude with an appetite for learning and developing further
English: Fluent
Desirable:
Experience using AWS Cloud technology
Knowledge of business intelligence reporting suites
Appreciation of emerging and newer technologies
1-2 years proven experience in using Airflow
Knowledge of JIRA and AGILE working practices
Knowledge of Jenkins
Knowledge of data science tools and techniques
Other programming languages
Benefits:
Discretionary bonus opportunity
Hybrid Working (within Flexmodes)
Private Medical Insurance
Dental Scheme
25 days holiday per year
On Site Gym
Subsidised Café
Free soft drinks
On site bar
Access to cycle garage and showers
Equal Opportunity Statement:
Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category.
We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.
PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

demographic_questions.header: UK Diversity & Inclusion - Voluntary Equal Opportunity Monitoring
demographic_questions.description:
Sony Interactive Entertainment Europe Limited (‘SIEE’) is committed to ensuring that all job applicants and members of staff are treated equally, without discrimination because of gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil partner status, gender reassignment, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, disability or age. Collecting diversity data is intended to help SIEE maintain equal opportunities best practice and identify barriers to workforce equality and diversity. Please read this notification and consent before you decide whether to submit your diversity data in the survey below. 

SIEE will treat all survey responses in the strictest confidence, and our personnel with decision-making role in the recruitment process can only see aggregated reports on the results of the survey and cannot allocate these aggregated reports to individual applicants. There is no obligation on you to provide diversity data, SIEE will treat all applicants the same regardless of whether they provide diversity data or not, and any responses to the survey will not affect our decision on your application.

You can withdraw your consent at any time. The withdrawal of your consent does not affect the lawfulness of the processing of your diversity data based on your consent before its withdrawal.
